decks.notes: The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to put early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like Monstrous Rage, Burst Lightning, and Heroes' Hangout help deal damage directly to the opponent or clear their blockers. The creatures in the deck, such as Emberheart Challenger and Questing Druid, are aggressive and can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck seeks to win the game before the opponent can mount a strong defense.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard, creating a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cheap spells and card draw effects, the deck aims to consistently recur the Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of flying attacks. The inclusion of extra turns with Temporal Trespass and additional damage with Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse further enhances the aggressive strategy, while also providing some control elements with counterspells like Spell Pierce and disruption with cards like Jwari Disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combination of Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate powerful synergies and overwhelming board presence. By controlling the board with cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Sheltered by Ghosts, and leveraging the mana base provided by cards like Godless Shrine and Brightclimb Pathway, this deck can quickly establish its dominance and overwhelm opponents with big threats and game-winning combos.

This Mono Black Control deck utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, combined with disruptive creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Gifted Aetherborn to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage, while Sheoldred, the Apocalypse can dominate the late game with its powerful abilities. The deck also includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Mutavault to provide additional value and flexibility. Overall, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through resource denial and efficient threats.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to prioritize a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Ygra, Eater of All and Vinereap Mentor to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes plenty of removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to control the board and protect your creatures. Additionally, cards like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar provide some recurring damage and value. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The key concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control your opponent's game plan using a variety of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. Utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Go for the Throat, Duress, and Thoughtseize, you aim to dismantle your opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Gifted Aetherborn, Graveyard Trespasser, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to seize control of the game. With the ability to generate card advantage with Castle Locthwain and Liliana of the Veil, this deck aims to grind out victories through attrition and superior resource management.

This Red Deck Wins aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of cheap, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Manifold Mouse and Sunspine Lynx, while using spells like Reckless Rage and Lightning Strike to clear the way and deal direct damage. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent, using efficient creatures and burn spells to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing spirits to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The key strategy is to use cards like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and protect your creatures with cards like Rattlechains. Enduring Curiosity helps draw cards and maintain card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, while also having a solid mana base to ensure consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells and utilizing the Arclight Phoenix to repeatedly bring it back to the battlefield. The goal is to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures like Picklock Prankster and Cori-Steel Cutter, while efficiently digging through the deck with cantrips like Opt and Consider. Treasure Cruise helps to refill the hand and maintain momentum. The deck is designed to be proactive and fast-paced, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and hand disruption spells. The mix of creatures with strong abilities and evasion, along with powerful removal spells, allows the deck to maintain a high level of aggression while also controlling the board. The deck also has a strong mana base designed to support its multicolored spells and ensure a consistent flow of resources throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using Greasefang Parhelion as a key combo piece to generate value and control the board. It has a mix of disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing powerful removal like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck also includes additional threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Overlord of the Balemurk to pressure the opponent. With cards like Parhelion II and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and removal spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo, utilizing cards like Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate powerful synergies and overwhelming board presence. The deck runs disruption and removal spells like Fatal Push, Duress, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The main objective is to efficiently assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures and powerful abilities, ultimately leading to victory through a well-executed game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to deliver fast and consistent damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and burn spells. With a low mana curve and a high number of cheap, efficient threats, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Key cards such as Emberheart Challenger, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Burst Lightning are all essential pieces of this aggressive strategy, while support cards like Shadowspear and Reckless Rage help to maintain pressure and clear the opponent's blockers.

This red aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. With cards like Emberheart Challenger, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Heartfire Hero, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to build up their defenses. Cards like Monstrous Rage, Burst Lightning, and Reckless Rage provide additional burn and removal options to clear the opponent's board and push through for a victory. The inclusion of Hazoret the Fervent as a finisher adds additional pressure to seal the deal.

The key concept of this UW Control deck is to establish board control and outvalue the opponent through the use of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With the help of Yorion as a companion, the deck aims to stabilize the board by consistently bouncing or removing threats, while generating card advantage and incremental card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge. The deck also utilizes a variety of removal spells and sweepers to deal with opposing threats, while slowly grinding out games with card advantage engines and powerful finishers like The Wandering Emperor and Castle Ardenvale.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix multiple times for aggressive, fast-paced attacks. It includes cards that allow for card draw, removal, and protection, as well as ways to cheat out Phoenix from the graveyard. The key strategy is to efficiently cast spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of powerful attacks. The deck aims to win by outpacing the opponent and maximizing the use of the Phoenix's recurring presence on the battlefield.
